TopicTitle: [0.25] Lionhead Aerospace Inc. - Icarus v0.4 updated

Articles.Content: Right now I'm in vacation but I'll have a look to these issues when I'll be back, may be I'll need a little help because I'm quite busy.
Rosetta Mission tease....
Sorry if i'm late, but I think i found the easter egg. Only if I know how to do spoiler tags...
Do you have an update for 0.25 for all of your mods. I've been using them. Thanks

I'll work on an update during next week, but everything must work yet.

Nice video Fyrem, I didn't forget you, I'm just very busy.

I'm working on the next update for Icarus mod. I'm fixing the few issues I found and may add more content if I add enough time and no main issue.

Already fix in the next patch:

- fix antenna lag

- fix size of Truss x2 and x4

- small radial docks now are closed by default (just open them in VAB and load them with your probe)

Please, fill free to report all issues you encounter with Icarus.

Edited November 4, 2014 by Yogui87

I'm working on the next update for Icarus mod. I'm fixing the few issues I found and may add more content if I add enough time and no main issue.

Please, fill free to report all issues you encounter with Icarus.

The truss scaling issue was the only problem I've been having with 0.25.

However, I have a comment about the gravity ring... The four spokes leading from the hub out to the outer ring are intended for Kerbals to move through, correct? The problem is, they appear to be way too skinny to actually allow a Kerbonaut to use as a corridor. Even a snug one. To me, they should be at least double the size. Also, for my own personal part, I've scaled it up so that the hub is 3.75 meters in diameter. This makes the outer ring big enough in cross section that it looks like Kerbals could actually live and sleep inside.

So there you go. I just think you could take another look at the architecture of the part and beef it up a bit in certain areas so that it looks like the Kerbs could fit inside, that's all.

Nuff said.

I present to you, the easter egg that I found late. Now with spoilers!

Un grand merci ÃƒÂ  vous pour ces travaux offerts ÃƒÂ  la communautÃƒÂ©!

Yogui87,

KSP Interstellar seems like it would be a great fit for the Icarus, as the ship is designed to be a grand tour capable mothership, and KSP Interstellar is IMO one of the best mods that I know of for making motherships that are actually worth using. (Worth using means "low part count, high delta-v, and high payload capacity, in order of importance.)

You would be able to use the code in KSP Interstellar to make all the parts work the way they're meant to work. It has solar sails that actually produce thrust, thrust from engines depends on reactor power, radiators are needed to keep reactors cool, etc.

One of the key advantages of KSP Interstellar is that you can make ships that are very useful but aren't actually made up of that many parts. The importance of this can not be overstated.

If a mothership lags the game before you add any landers or probes to it, it's not worth using because it's only going to lag more when fully loaded.

Basically, the thing I'm most worried about when I design any mothership is making it something I'll actually use, instead of something that just sits abandoned in orbit, and lag is reason number 1 for me to NOT use something.

I'd like to see some IVAs, as well as the standard command pod without the arms coming off the front, I'd also like part descriptions, if it's not too much to ask. Other than that keep up the good work.
